sn2.23:1.1: Standing to one side, the god Serī addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn2.23:2.3: So what’s the name of the spirit
sn2.23:3.2: and a clear and confident heart,
sn2.23:3.4: in this world and the next.
sn2.23:4.2: overcoming that stain, and give a gift.
sn2.23:4.3: The good deeds of sentient beings
sn2.23:4.4: support them in the next world.”
sn2.23:5.2: how well said this was by Master Gotama.” He repeated the Buddha’s verses, and said:
sn2.23:8.1: “Once upon a time, sir, I was a king named Serī, a giver, a donor, who praised giving.
sn2.23:8.2: I gave gifts at the four gates to ascetics and brahmins, to paupers, vagrants, nomads, and beggars.
sn2.23:8.3: Then the ladies of my harem approached me and said,
sn2.23:8.4: ‘Your Majesty gives gifts, but we don’t.
sn2.23:8.5: Your Majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
sn2.23:8.7: ‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
sn2.23:8.8: When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’
sn2.23:8.9: And so I gave the first gate to the ladies of my harem.
sn2.23:8.10: There they gave gifts, while my own giving dwindled.
sn2.23:9.1: Then my aristocrat vassals approached me and said,
sn2.23:9.2: ‘Your Majesty gives gifts, the ladies of your harem give gifts, but we don’t.
sn2.23:9.3: Your Majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
sn2.23:9.5: ‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
sn2.23:9.6: When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’
sn2.23:9.7: And so I gave the second gate to my aristocrat vassals.
sn2.23:9.8: There they gave gifts, while my own giving dwindled.
sn2.23:10.1: Then my troops approached me and said,
sn2.23:10.2: ‘Your Majesty gives gifts, the ladies of your harem give gifts, your aristocrat vassals give gifts, but we don’t.
sn2.23:10.3: Your Majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
sn2.23:10.5: ‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
sn2.23:10.6: When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’
sn2.23:10.7: And so I gave the third gate to my troops.
sn2.23:10.8: There they gave gifts, while my own giving dwindled.
sn2.23:11.1: Then my brahmins and householders approached me and said,
sn2.23:11.2: ‘Your Majesty gives gifts, the ladies of your harem give gifts, your aristocrat vassals give gifts, your troops give gifts, but we don’t.
sn2.23:11.3: Your Majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
sn2.23:11.5: ‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
sn2.23:11.6: When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’
sn2.23:11.7: And so I gave the fourth gate to my brahmins and householders.
sn2.23:11.8: There they gave gifts, while my own giving dwindled.
sn2.23:12.1: Then my men approached me and said,
sn2.23:12.2: ‘Now Your Majesty is not giving gifts at all!’
sn2.23:12.3: When they said this, I said to those men,
sn2.23:12.4: ‘So then, my men, send half of the revenue from the outer districts to the royal compound. Then give half right there to ascetics and brahmins, to paupers, vagrants, nomads, and beggars.’
sn2.23:12.5: Sir, for a long time I made so much merit and did so many skillful deeds. I never reached any limit so as to say
sn2.23:12.6: ‘there’s this much merit’ or ‘there’s this much result of merit’ or ‘for so long I’ll remain in heaven’.
sn2.23:12.8: how well said this was by Master Gotama:
sn2.23:13.2: and a clear and confident heart,
sn2.23:13.4: in this world and the next.
sn2.23:14.2: overcoming that stain, and give a gift.
sn2.23:14.3: The good deeds of sentient beings
sn2.23:14.4: support them in the next world.’”
